column2: Notes:Object is covered in extremely sticky slime.
Notes:Object obeys your commands as best it can. It can walk 15ft per round.
Notes:A touched animal either gains human intelligence or human appearance for L days.
Notes:You can see through a magical floating eyeball that flies around at your command.
Notes:An object is frozen in time and space within an invulnerable crystal shell.
Notes:L+1 objects are strongly magnetically attracted to each other if they come within 10 feet.
Notes:You create illusory sounds that seem to come from a direction of your choice.
Notes:A creature must loudly and clearly repeat everything you think. It is otherwise mute.
Notes:You and your possessions transform into a mundane animal.
Notes:L creatures of your choice are unable to form new short-term memories for the duration of the spell.
Notes:Roll L+1 d20s. Whenever you must roll a d20 after casting the spell, you must choose and then discard one of the rolled results until they are all gone.
Notes:Your arms turn into huge bird wings.
Notes:You switch bodies with a creature you touch. If one body dies, the other dies as well.
Notes:A woman wearing a blue dress appears until end of spell. She will obey polite, safe requests.
Notes:L creatures treat you like a friend.
Notes:A creature obeys a single, three-word command that does not harm it.
Notes:You become fluent in all languages.
Notes:Nearby plants and trees obey you and gain the ability to move at 5 feet per round.
Notes:You may alter the type of weather at will, but you do not otherwise control it.

Notes:Make an opposed Intelligence save against the Intelligence of the caster of a nearby spell. You may do this out of turn as a reaction, or against an ongoing magical effect. On a success, you may cancel the spell.
Notes:All nearby creatures are deafened.
Notes:You hear nearby magical auras singing. Volume and harmony signify the auras power and refinement.
Notes:Any of your body parts may be detached and reattached at will, without causing pain or damage. You can still control them.
Notes:You may alter the appearance of L characters at will as long as they remain humanoid. Attempts to duplicate other characters will seem uncanny.
Notes:An object appears to be up to L×10ft from its actual position.
Notes:The ground begins shaking violently. Structures may be damaged or collapse.
Notes:Your body can stretch up to L×10ft.
Notes:A straight wall of ice or fire L×40ft long and 10ft high rises from the ground.
Notes:L visible items teleport to your hands.
Notes:Dense fog spreads out from you.
Notes:L creatures erupt in a frenzy of violence.
Notes:A portal to a random plane opens.
Notes:You can change the direction of gravity (for yourself only) up to once per round.
Notes:L creatures develop an overwhelming urge to possess a visible item of your choice.
Notes:Your movement speed is tripled.
Notes:L creatures develop a deep hatred of another creature or group of creatures and wish to destroy it.
Notes:You can hear faint sounds clearly.
Notes:An object hovers, frictionless, 2ft above the ground. It can hold up to L humanoids.
Notes:A creature enters a trance and will truthfully answer L yes or no questions you ask it.
Notes:A thick ice layer spreads across a touched surface, up to L×10ft in radius.
Notes:A floating light moves as you command.
Notes:The gravity in an area triples.
Notes:Two objects within 10ft of each other cannot be moved more than 10ft apart.
Notes:L nearby mundane or magical locks unlock.
Notes:You can jump up to L×10ft in the air.
Notes:The air around you becomes swimmable.
Notes:All nearby magical effects have their effectiveness halved.
Notes:A sturdy, furnished cottage appears for L×12 hours. You can permit and forbid entry to it at will.
Notes:Your pockets are full of marbles, and will refill every round.
Notes:L characters appearances and voices become identical to a touched character.
Notes:You and L other touched creatures are reduced to the size of a mouse.
Notes:L illusory duplicates of yourself appear under your control.
Notes:A mirror becomes a gateway to another mirror that you looked into today.
Notes:You gain L extra arms.
Notes:An L×40ft wide sphere of darkness displaying the night sky appears.
Notes:You become any inanimate object between the size of a grand piano and an apple.
Notes:You become a living jelly.
L creatures have an aversion to violence.
Notes:A ghostly coach appears until end of spell. It moves unnaturally fast over any terrain, including water.
Notes:L creatures become terrified of an object of your choice.
Notes:A pit 10ft wide and L×5ft deep opens in the ground.
Notes:An object grows to the size of an elephant. If it is an animal, it is enraged.
Notes:The referee answers L yes or no questions about a touched object.
Notes:An object of any size is pulled directly towards you with the strength of L men for one round.
Notes:An object of any size is pushed directly away from you with the strength of L men for one round.
Notes:L skeletons rise from the ground to serve you. They are incredibly stupid and can only obey simple orders.
Notes:The spirit of a dead body manifests and will answer L questions.
Notes:You can hear the surface thoughts of nearby creatures.
Notes:L+1 objects are strongly magnetically repelled from each other if they come within 10 feet.
Notes:You can see through the eyes of a creature you touched earlier today.
Notes:All inanimate material behaves like clay in your hands.
Notes:L creatures are invisible until they move.
Notes:L creatures instantly switch places. Determine where they end up randomly.
Notes:L creatures fall into a light sleep.
Notes:Your body becomes living smoke.
Notes:10 minutes after casting, a knight sitting astride a giant snail rides into view. He is able to answer most questions related to quests and chivalry, and may aid you if he finds you worthy.
Notes:You can smell even the faintest traces of scents.
Notes:Inanimate items sort themselves according to categories you set. The categories must be visually verifiable.
Notes:A clearly unreal but impressive illusion of your choice appears, under your control. It may be up to the size of a palace and has full motion and sound.
Notes:Cast this as a reaction to another spell going off to make a temporary copy of it that you can cast at any time before this spell ends.
Notes:You can climb surfaces like a spider.
Notes:Once per second, (6 times per round) you may summon or banish a 3-foot-wide cube of earth. New cubes must be affixed to the earth or to other cubes.
Notes:You become a swarm of crows, rats, or piranhas. You only take damage from area effects.
Notes:You may mentally move L items.
Notes:L+1 creatures can hear each others thoughts, no matter how far apart they move.
Notes:An object disappears and reappears on the ground in a visible, clear area up to L×40ft away.
Notes:Object becomes the target of every spell cast near it.
Notes:A thicket of trees and dense brush up to L×40ft wide suddenly sprouts up.
Notes:An object disappears as it jumps L×10 minutes into the future. When it returns, it appears in the unoccupied area nearest to where it left.
Notes:A carved stone statue the size of a four poster bed rises from the ground.
Notes:Time in a 40ft bubble starts moving 10 times faster.
Notes:Time in a 40ft bubble slows to 10%.
Notes:You see through all nearby illusions.
Notes:A spring of seawater appears.
Notes:You completely control what a creature sees.
Notes:A silent, immobile, illusion of your choice appears, up to the size of a bedroom.
Notes:A silver circle 40ft across appears on the ground. Choose one thing that cannot cross it: Living creatures, dead creatures, projectiles or metal.
Notes:Your wrists can shoot thick webbing.
Notes:Your finger can shoot a stream of ulfire-colored paint. This paint is only visible to you, and can be seen at any distance, even through solid objects.
Notes:You gain X-Ray vision.
